etymologies: late Middle English: from in kenebowe in Middle English, probably from Old Norse

definitions: with hands on the hips and elbows turned outward

examples.text: she stood with arms akimbo, frowning at the small boy

shortDefinitions: with hands on hips and elbows turned outwards

definitions: (of other limbs) flung out widely or haphazardly

examples.text: he collapsed on the bed, legs akimbo
